Figure 18.2
Competitive Market Positions and Roles
Each market position calls for a different competitive strategy. For example, the market leader wants to expand total demand and protect or expand its share. Market nichers seek market segments that are big enough to be profitable but small enough to be of little interest to major competitors.
Market leader Market challengers Market followers Market nichers
40% 30% 20% 10%
summary_markdown: Figure 18.2 outlines competitive market positions and their associated roles, illustrating a market structure based on share percentage. The market leader, holding the largest share at 40%, focuses on expanding total demand and defending or increasing its market share. Market challengers, with 30% of the market, aim to attack the leader and gain share. Market followers, holding 20% of the market, are content to maintain their current share and avoid challenging competitors. Finally, market nichers, representing 10% of the market, target specific, profitable segments that are too small to attract major competitors. This structure highlights a hierarchy of market influence, from the dominant leader to specialized nichers, each employing distinct competitive strategies.
